meanings.definition: A person or thing serving as a typical example or excellent model.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the wise old owl was seen as an exemplar of wisdom.
meanings.sent2: The teacher showed the students different exemplars of good behavior.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot tried to be an exemplar of good manners, but ended up mimicking the dog instead.
meanings.sent4: Her grandmother's antique necklace was an exemplar of timeless beauty.
meanings.sent5: The majestic eagle soaring high in the sky was an exemplar of freedom.

meanings.definition: A typical or good example of something.
meanings.sent1: The painting was considered an exemplar of creativity in the art class.
meanings.sent2: The recipe book contained many exemplars of delicious desserts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten thought knocking over the vase was an exemplar of a successful prank.
meanings.sent4: The blooming rose in the garden was an exemplar of natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The shining star in the night sky was an exemplar of hope for the lost travelers.
